author: Special Correspondent
text:
Flying Squad conducting vehicle check at Abhishekapatti near here on Friday intercepted a vehicle carrying “unaccounted cash” to the tune of Rs. 12.59 lakh and seized it.

Even as the flying squad, led by Tahsildar Murugan, was conducting vehicle check near Manonmaniam Sundaranar University at Abhishekapatti near here on Friday afternoon, they intercepted a private vehicle, proceeding from Tenkasi to Tirunelveli, in which cash had been kept in three jumbo bags.

When the three occupants of the van told the flying squad members that they were taking Rs. 64 lakh to stock it in the ATMs, Mr. Murugan and others checked the documents they had for carrying the cash.

When they could not account for Rs. 12.59 lakh, they told the officials that they were taking cash of Rs. 75,142 on behalf of a textile showroom and Rs. 11,63,453 of a jewellery showroom to be remitted in a bank.

Hence Rs. 12.59 lakh was seized.

Collector M. Karunakaran said the confiscated cash would be returned only after proper documents were submitted to account for the money.

Vehicle check

As he came out of the premises of Rani Anna Government College for Women at Pettai after inaugurating voter awareness programme there, Dr. Karunakaran, along with flying squad members, started checking a few vehicles that were passing through the Tirunelveli – Tenkasi Highway.

Be vigilant

He asked the flying squad members and the police personnel deployed at the check-post to be vigilant till the electoral process was over.
title: Flying squad seizes unaccounted cash
